SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

statgraphics.survival
Class SurvivalEstimatePlot

java.lang.Object
  statgraphics.GraphicalAnalysis
      statgraphics.survival.SurvivalEstimatePlot

public class SurvivalEstimatePlot
extends GraphicalAnalysis

Generates a survival estimate plot.


Example:
double [] sortedTime = {{59, 115, 156, 268, 329, 353, 365, 431, 464, 475, 563, 638, 700},
                                           {76, 105, 144, 201, 254, 315, 447, 527, 655}};
double [] sortedSurvivalEstimate1 = {0.9615, 0.9231, 0.8846, 0.8462, 0.8077, 0.7692,
                                                                  0.7308, 0.6878, 0.6419, 0.5961, 0.5464, 0.4967, 0.4967};
double[] sortedSurvivalEstimate2 = {0.8812, 0.8234, 0.7689, 0.6612, 0.5644, 0.5034, 0.3416, 0.3001, 0.2219}};
String[] names = new String[]{"Control", "Treatment"};

PlotFrame pf = new PlotFrame("Kaplan-Meier Estimate Plot I",
    new SurvivalEstimatePlot(names[0], sortedTime1, sortedSurvivalEstimate1).getPlot(), 500, 270);

pf = new PlotFrame("Kaplan-Meier Estimate Plot II",
    new SurvivalEstimatePlot(names, new double[][]{sortedTime1, sortedTime2},
    new double[][]{sortedSurvivalEstimate1, sortedSurvivalEstimate2}). plot, 500, 270);

// Another way to generate the time series plot
Hashtable argument = new Hashtable();
argument.put(DATA_NAMES, names[0]);
GraphicalAnalysis graphicalAnalysis = new SurvivalEstimatePlot(
    argument, sortedTime1, sortedSurvivalEstimate1).graphicalAnalysis;
JFreeChart myPlot = (JFreeChart) graphicalAnalysis.output.get("PLOT");
pf = new PlotFrame("Kaplan-Meier Estimate Plot III", myPlot, 500, 270);

argument.put(DATA_NAMES, names);
graphicalAnalysis = new SurvivalEstimatePlot(argument, new double[][]{sortedTime1, sortedTime2},
    new double[][]{sortedSurvivalEstimate1, sortedSurvivalEstimate2}). graphicalAnalysis;
pf = new PlotFrame("Kaplan-Meier Estimate Plot IV", graphicalAnalysis.plot, 500, 270);

// Places the plot frame in a container
new PlotFrameFactory().putPlotFrame(pf);

Constructor Detail

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot()
Default SurvivalEstimatePlot constructor.

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot(java.util.Hashtable argument,
                            java.lang.Object... dataObject)
Creates a new survival estimate plot given the input arguments and data.

Parameters:
argument - the arguments with the following choices,
DATANAMES, TITLE, XLABEL, YLABEL: complete list of arguments;
DATANAMES: the default title "Survival Estimate Plot", x-label "Survival Time", and y-label "Survival Estimate".

dataObject - the series of survival times in ascending order and associated survival estimates in descending order.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - wrong input argument(s) or data or data type.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the sortedTime vector and sortedSurvivalEstimate vector must have the same length.

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot(java.lang.String[] dataNames,
                            java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String xLabel,
                            java.lang.String yLabel,
                            double[][] sortedTime,
                            double[][] sortedSurvivalEstimate)
Creates a new survival estimate plot with the specified names of the survival data, title, and labels for the x-coordinate and y-coordinate.

Parameters:
dataNames - the names of these series.
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th series.
title - the plot title.
xLabel - the label for the x-coordinate.
yLabel - the label for the y-coordinate.
sortedTime - the series of survival times in ascending order,
sortedTime[j]: the (j+1)'th series of survival times.
sortedSurvivalEstimate - the series of survival estimates in descending order,
sortedSurvivalEstimate[j]: the (j+1)'th series of survival estimates.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the sortedTime vector and sortedSurvivalEstimate vector must have the same length.

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot(java.lang.String dataName,
                            java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String xLabel,
                            java.lang.String yLabel,
                            double[] sortedTime,
                            double[] sortedSurvivalEstimate)
Creates a new survival estimate plot with the specified title and labels for the x-coordinate and y-coordinate.

Parameters:
dataName - the name of the input survival data.
title - the plot title.
xLabel - the label for the x-coordinate.
yLabel - the label for the y-coordinate.
sortedTime - the survival times in ascending order.
sortedSurvivalEstimate - the survival estimates in descending order.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentExceptionn - the sortedTime vector and sortedSurvivalEstimate vector must have the same length.

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot(java.lang.String[] dataNames,
                            double[][] sortedTime,
                            double[][] sortedSurvivalEstimate)
Creates a new survival estimate plot with the specified names of the survival data and default title "Survival Estimate Plot", x-label "Survival Time", and y-label "Survival Estimate".

Parameters:
dataNames - the names of these series.
dataNames[j]: the name of the (j+1)'th series.
sortedTime - the series of survival times in ascending order,
sortedTime[j]: the (j+1)'th series of survival times.
sortedSurvivalEstimate - the series of survival estimates in descending order,
sortedSurvivalEstimate[j]: the (j+1)'th series of survival estimates.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the sortedTime vector and sortedSurvivalEstimate vector must have the same length.

SurvivalEstimatePlot

public SurvivalEstimatePlot(java.lang.String dataName,
                            double[] sortedTime,
                            double[] sortedSurvivalEstimate)
Creates a new survival estimate plot with the specified name of the survival data and default title "Survival Estimate Plot", x-label "Survival Time", and y-label "Survival Estimate".

Parameters:
dataName - the name of the input survival data.
sortedTime - the survival times in ascending order.
sortedSurvivalEstimate - the survival estimates in descending order.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the sortedTime vector and sortedSurvivalEstimate vector must have the same length.
